content.description: Start on a jug on the left arête and climb up the facing using pockets, smears, and the occasional jug on the arête. Topout.
content.location: This line follows the left arête along the left side of the main face of the egg shaped boulder.

content.description: Start on your choice of jugs on the the left side of the left arête on the large egg boulder. Follow jugs straight up to a committing sloping topout with a few crimps and smears. The top is the crux.
content.location: This line follows the low angle slab on the left side of the left arête on the large egg boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the sand below large sloping underclings. Use the smeary feet below to make a long move to either a pocket around the arête or a pinch to the left. Use the obvious large smear jug on the arête to move up through a sidepull, pockets, and slopers. Trend left along large pockets to the left sloping arête and topout. Pretty tall and committing, but very sequence dependent.
content.protection: Either multiple pads or two pads and a spotter to move pads. There is a large fallen tree in the landing for most of the crux moves.
content.location: This line starts under the only overhanging part of the egg shaped boulder and moves up the right arête before trending left to a mellower topout.

climbs.name: Can I Offer You A Nice Egg?

content.description: Sit start on either underclings or a pair of pinches (one is higher up). Move up the vertical iron groves through large pockets, underclings, and sidepulls to a committing sloping topout at the arête.
content.protection: 1 pad will suffice, but it is a little tall.
content.location: This line climbs up the left side left face of the egg shaped boulder.
